intro: Draba huetii, commonly known as the Huet's whitlow grass, is a small, flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its tiny, clustered flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. It produces small, yellow or white flowers that bloom in early spring, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. Draba huetii is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
